fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (23:45): all hail larsi! :)

c938c62ecadcab91676bdf5e857fb8ca (00:04): If there's a need.

139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:08): my first one was going to be Degrade Gracefully
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:08): which is just the converse of yours, in a way
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:20): is there something significant about the semantics of concurring and abstaining in a W3C vote that I should know about? why does concur exist?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:21): maybe in case there is a quorum?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:22): maybe some resolutions can only pass by absolute majority, including abstaining votes?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:22): (although that would make abstain equivalent to a no vote)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:22): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884: I see. I didn't consider quorum.
39446a94055a1d99d64ee4c4112d92bf (00:23): I hope there is no quorum in this group : it is a nearly public wg, there may be many inactive "invited expert" in the future
c938c62ecadcab91676bdf5e857fb8ca (00:24): I'm sure there will be a few rounds of house cleaning.
c938c62ecadcab91676bdf5e857fb8ca (00:26): At least to change membership from "Good" to "Not Good" standing.
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:26): I don't think we should require quorum
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:26): especially since we'll give at least a week to give input on decisions
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (00:30): http://www.w3.org/2005/10/Process-20051014/policies.html#def-Consensus

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (00:30): Consensus: A substantial number of individuals in the set support the decision and nobody in the set registers a Formal Objection. Individuals in the set may abstain. Abstention is either an explicit expression of no opinion or silence by an individual in the set. Unanimity is the particular case of consensus where all individuals in the set support the decision (i.e., no individual in the set abstains).

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (00:30): By default, the set of individuals eligible to participate in a decision is the set of group participants in Good Standing. The Process Document does not require a quorum for decisions (i.e., the minimal number of eligible participants required to be present before the Chair can call a question). A charter MAY include a quorum requirement for consensus decisions.
c938c62ecadcab91676bdf5e857fb8ca (00:31): Well, there we go. :-)
39446a94055a1d99d64ee4c4112d92bf (00:31): thank you for the precision
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:36): f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb: thanks. I guess I concur then.
